trans-unit.source: Represents a non-generic collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index.
<xref:System.Collections.IList> is a descendant of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface and is the base interface of all non-generic lists.
<xref:System.Collections.IList> implementations fall into three categories: read-only, fixed-size, and variable-size.
A read-only <xref:System.Collections.IList> cannot be modified.
A fixed-size <xref:System.Collections.IList> does not allow the addition or removal of elements, but it allows the modification of existing elements.
A variable-size <xref:System.Collections.IList> allows the addition, removal, and modification of elements.
For the generic version of this interface, see <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601?displayProperty=fullName>.
Adds an item to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The object to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted, or -1 to indicate that the item was not inserted into the collection.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes all items from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
Implementations of this method can vary in how they handle the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and the capacity of a collection.
Typically, the count is set to zero, and references to other objects from elements of the collection are also released.
The capacity can be set to zero or a default value, or it can remain unchanged.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> contains a specific value.

Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, this method uses the collection’s objects’ <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods on `item` to determine whether item exists.

In the earlier versions of the .NET Framework, this determination was made by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods of the `item` parameter on the objects in the collection.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Determines the index of a specific item in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.

Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, this method uses the collection’s objects’ <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods on `item` to determine whether item exists.

In the earlier versions of the .NET Framework, this determination was made by using the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> and <xref:System.IComparable.CompareTo%2A> methods of the `item` parameter on the objects in the collection.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> at the specified index.
If `index` equals the number of items in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>, then `value` is appended to the end.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.
If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The object to insert into the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size.
value is null reference in the .
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size.
A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`.
The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Item%2A> property.
Visual Basic implements <xref:System.Collections.IList.Item%2A> as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
index is not a valid index in the .
The property is set and the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot.
If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
If `value` is not found in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>, the <xref:System.Collections.IList> remains unchanged and no exception is thrown.
The object to remove from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size.
Removes the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> item at the specified index.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot.
If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read-only.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size.
